00067 struct proc_dir_entry *
00068 lprocfs_add_simple(struct proc_dir_entry *root, char *name,
00069                    void *data, const struct file_operations *fops)
00070 {
00071         struct proc_dir_entry *proc;
00072         mode_t mode = 0;
00073 
00074         if (root == NULL || name == NULL || fops == NULL)
00075                 return ERR_PTR(-EINVAL);
00076 
00077         if (fops->read)
00078                 mode = 0444;
00079         if (fops->write)
00080                 mode |= 0200;
00081         proc = proc_create_data(name, mode, root, fops, data);
00082         if (!proc) {
00083                 CERROR("LprocFS: No memory to create /proc entry %s\n",
00084                        name);
00085                 return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
00086         }
00087         return proc;
00088 }
00089 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_add_simple);
00090 
00091 struct proc_dir_entry *lprocfs_add_symlink(const char *name,
00092                         struct proc_dir_entry *parent, const char *format, ...)
00093 {
00094         struct proc_dir_entry *entry;
00095         char *dest;
00096         va_list ap;
00097 
00098         if (parent == NULL || format == NULL)
00099                 return NULL;
00100 
00101         OBD_ALLOC_WAIT(dest, MAX_STRING_SIZE + 1);
00102         if (dest == NULL)
00103                 return NULL;
00104 
00105         va_start(ap, format);
00106         vsnprintf(dest, MAX_STRING_SIZE, format, ap);
00107         va_end(ap);
00108 
00109         entry = proc_symlink(name, parent, dest);
00110         if (entry == NULL)
00111                 CERROR("LprocFS: Could not create symbolic link from "
00112                        "%s to %s\n", name, dest);
00113 
00114         OBD_FREE(dest, MAX_STRING_SIZE + 1);
00115         return entry;
00116 }
00117 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_add_symlink);
00118 
00119 static const struct file_operations lprocfs_generic_fops = { };
00120 
00132 int
00133 lprocfs_add_vars(struct proc_dir_entry *root, struct lprocfs_vars *list,
00134                  void *data)
00135 {
00136         if (root == NULL || list == NULL)
00137                 return -EINVAL;
00138 
00139         while (list->name != NULL) {
00140                 struct proc_dir_entry *proc;
00141                 mode_t mode = 0;
00142 
00143                 if (list->proc_mode != 0000) {
00144                         mode = list->proc_mode;
00145                 } else if (list->fops) {
00146                         if (list->fops->read)
00147                                 mode = 0444;
00148                         if (list->fops->write)
00149                                 mode |= 0200;
00150                 }
00151                 proc = proc_create_data(list->name, mode, root,
00152                                         list->fops ?: &lprocfs_generic_fops,
00153                                         list->data ?: data);
00154                 if (proc == NULL)
00155                         return -ENOMEM;
00156                 list++;
00157         }
00158         return 0;
00159 }
00160 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_add_vars);
00161 
00162 #ifndef HAVE_REMOVE_PROC_SUBTREE
00163 /* for b=10866, global variable */
00164 DECLARE_RWSEM(_lprocfs_lock);
00165 EXPORT_SYMBOL(_lprocfs_lock);
00166 
00167 static void lprocfs_remove_nolock(struct proc_dir_entry **proot)
00168 {
00169         struct proc_dir_entry *root = *proot;
00170         struct proc_dir_entry *temp = root;
00171         struct proc_dir_entry *rm_entry;
00172         struct proc_dir_entry *parent;
00173 
00174         *proot = NULL;
00175         if (root == NULL || IS_ERR(root))
00176                 return;
00177 
00178         parent = root->parent;
00179         LASSERT(parent != NULL);
00180 
00181         while (1) {
00182                 while (temp->subdir != NULL)
00183                         temp = temp->subdir;
00184 
00185                 rm_entry = temp;
00186                 temp = temp->parent;
00187 
00188                 /* Memory corruption once caused this to fail, and
00189                    without this LASSERT we would loop here forever. */
00190                 LASSERTF(strlen(rm_entry->name) == rm_entry->namelen,
00191                          "0x%p  %s/%s len %d\n", rm_entry, temp->name,
00192                          rm_entry->name, (int)strlen(rm_entry->name));
00193 
00194                 remove_proc_entry(rm_entry->name, temp);
00195                 if (temp == parent)
00196                         break;
00197         }
00198 }
00199 
00200 int remove_proc_subtree(const char *name, struct proc_dir_entry *parent)
00201 {
00202         struct proc_dir_entry    *t = NULL;
00203         struct proc_dir_entry   **p;
00204         int                       len, busy = 0;
00205 
00206         LASSERT(parent != NULL);
00207         len = strlen(name);
00208 
00209         down_write(&_lprocfs_lock);
00210         /* lookup target name */
00211         for (p = &parent->subdir; *p; p = &(*p)->next) {
00212                 if ((*p)->namelen != len)
00213                         continue;
00214                 if (memcmp(name, (*p)->name, len))
00215                         continue;
00216                 t = *p;
00217                 break;
00218         }
00219 
00220         if (t) {
00221                 /* verify it's empty: do not count "num_refs" */
00222                 for (p = &t->subdir; *p; p = &(*p)->next) {
00223                         if ((*p)->namelen != strlen("num_refs")) {
00224                                 busy = 1;
00225                                 break;
00226                         }
00227                         if (memcmp("num_refs", (*p)->name,
00228                                    strlen("num_refs"))) {
00229                                 busy = 1;
00230                                 break;
00231                         }
00232                 }
00233         }
00234 
00235         if (busy == 0)
00236                 lprocfs_remove_nolock(&t);
00237 
00238         up_write(&_lprocfs_lock);
00239         return 0;
00240 }
00241 #endif /* !HAVE_REMOVE_PROC_SUBTREE */
00242 
00243 #ifndef HAVE_PROC_REMOVE
00244 void proc_remove(struct proc_dir_entry *de)
00245 {
00246 #ifndef HAVE_REMOVE_PROC_SUBTREE
00247         down_write(&_lprocfs_lock); /* search vs remove race */
00248         lprocfs_remove_nolock(&de);
00249         up_write(&_lprocfs_lock);
00250 #else
00251         if (de)
00252                 remove_proc_subtree(de->name, de->parent);
00253 #endif
00254 }
00255 #endif
00256 
00257 void lprocfs_remove(struct proc_dir_entry **rooth)
00258 {
00259         proc_remove(*rooth);
00260         *rooth = NULL;
00261 }
00262 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_remove);
00263 
00264 void lprocfs_remove_proc_entry(const char *name, struct proc_dir_entry *parent)
00265 {
00266         LASSERT(parent != NULL);
00267         remove_proc_entry(name, parent);
00268 }
00269 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_remove_proc_entry);
00270 
00271 struct proc_dir_entry *
00272 lprocfs_register(const char *name, struct proc_dir_entry *parent,
00273                  struct lprocfs_vars *list, void *data)
00274 {
00275         struct proc_dir_entry *newchild;
00276 
00277         newchild = proc_mkdir(name, parent);
00278         if (newchild == NULL)
00279                 return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
00280 
00281         if (list != NULL) {
00282                 int rc = lprocfs_add_vars(newchild, list, data);
00283                 if (rc) {
00284                         lprocfs_remove(&newchild);
00285                         return ERR_PTR(rc);
00286                 }
00287         }
00288         return newchild;
00289 }
00290 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_register);

00292 /* Generic callbacks */
00293 int lprocfs_uint_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *data)
00294 {
00295         seq_printf(m, "%u\n", *(unsigned int *)data);
00296         return 0;
00297 }
00298 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_uint_seq_show);
00299 
00300 int lprocfs_wr_uint(struct file *file, const char __user *buffer,
00301                     unsigned long count, void *data)
00302 {
00303         unsigned *p = data;
00304         char dummy[MAX_STRING_SIZE + 1], *end;
00305         unsigned long tmp;
00306 
00307         dummy[MAX_STRING_SIZE] = '\0';
00308         if (copy_from_user(dummy, buffer, MAX_STRING_SIZE))
00309                 return -EFAULT;
00310 
00311         tmp = simple_strtoul(dummy, &end, 0);
00312         if (dummy == end)
00313                 return -EINVAL;
00314 
00315         *p = (unsigned int)tmp;
00316         return count;
00317 }
00318 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_wr_uint);
00319 
00320 ssize_t lprocfs_uint_seq_write(struct file *file, const char __user *buffer,
00321                                size_t count, loff_t *off)
00322 {
00323         int *data = ((struct seq_file *)file->private_data)->private;
00324         int rc;
00325         __s64 val = 0;
00326 
00327         rc = lprocfs_str_to_s64(buffer, count, &val);
00328         if (rc < 0)
00329                 return rc;
00330 
00331         return lprocfs_wr_uint(file, buffer, count, data);
00332 }
00333 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_uint_seq_write);

00343 int lprocfs_atomic_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *data)
00344 {
00345         atomic_t *atom = data;
00346         LASSERT(atom != NULL);

00348         return 0;
00349 }
00350 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_atomic_seq_show);
00351 
00352 ssize_t
00353 lprocfs_atomic_seq_write(struct file *file, const char __user *buffer,
00354                         size_t count, loff_t *off)
00355 {
00356         atomic_t *atm = ((struct seq_file *)file->private_data)->private;
00357         __s64 val = 0;
00358         int rc;
00359 
00360         rc = lprocfs_str_to_s64(buffer, count, &val);
00361         if (rc < 0)
00362                 return rc;
00363 
00364         if (val <= 0 || val > INT_MAX)
00365                 return -ERANGE;
00366 
00367         atomic_set(atm, val);
00368         return count;
00369 }
00370 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_atomic_seq_write);

00392 int lprocfs_blksize_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *data)
00393 {
00394         struct obd_device *obd = data;
00395         struct obd_statfs  osfs;
00396         int rc = obd_statfs(NULL, obd->obd_self_export, &osfs,
00397                             cfs_time_shift_64(-OBD_STATFS_CACHE_SECONDS),
00398                             OBD_STATFS_NODELAY);
00399         if (!rc)
00400                 seq_printf(m, "%u\n", osfs.os_bsize);
00401         return rc;
00402 }
00403 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_blksize_seq_show);
00404 
00405 int lprocfs_kbytestotal_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *data)
00406 {
00407         struct obd_device *obd = data;
00408         struct obd_statfs  osfs;
00409         int rc = obd_statfs(NULL, obd->obd_self_export, &osfs,
00410                             cfs_time_shift_64(-OBD_STATFS_CACHE_SECONDS),
00411                             OBD_STATFS_NODELAY);
00412         if (!rc) {
00413                 __u32 blk_size = osfs.os_bsize >> 10;
00414                 __u64 result = osfs.os_blocks;
00415 
00416                 while (blk_size >>= 1)
00417                         result <<= 1;
00418 
00419                 seq_printf(m, LPU64"\n", result);
00420         }
00421         return rc;
00422 }
00423 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_kbytestotal_seq_show);
00424

00491 int lprocfs_server_uuid_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *data)
00492 {
00493         struct obd_device *obd = data;
00494         struct obd_import *imp;
00495         char *imp_state_name = NULL;
00496         int rc = 0;
00497 
00498         LASSERT(obd != NULL);
00499         LPROCFS_CLIMP_CHECK(obd);
00500         imp = obd->u.cli.cl_import;
00501         imp_state_name = ptlrpc_import_state_name(imp->imp_state);
00502         seq_printf(m, "%s\t%s%s\n", obd2cli_tgt(obd), imp_state_name,
00503                    imp->imp_deactive ? "\tDEACTIVATED" : "");
00504 
00505         LPROCFS_CLIMP_EXIT(obd);
00506         return rc;
00507 }
00508 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_server_uuid_seq_show);

00510 int lprocfs_conn_uuid_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *data)
00511 {
00512         struct obd_device *obd = data;
00513         struct ptlrpc_connection *conn;
00514         int rc = 0;
00515 
00516         LASSERT(obd != NULL);
00517 
00518         LPROCFS_CLIMP_CHECK(obd);
00519         conn = obd->u.cli.cl_import->imp_connection;
00520         if (conn && obd->u.cli.cl_import)
00521                 seq_printf(m, "%s\n", conn->c_remote_uuid.uuid);
00522         else
00523                 seq_printf(m, "%s\n", "<none>");
00524 
00525         LPROCFS_CLIMP_EXIT(obd);
00526         return rc;
00527 }
00528 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_conn_uuid_seq_show);
00529 
00531 void lprocfs_stats_collect(struct lprocfs_stats *stats, int idx,
00532                            struct lprocfs_counter *cnt)
00533 {
00534         unsigned int                    num_entry;
00535         struct lprocfs_counter          *percpu_cntr;
00536         int                             i;
00537         unsigned long                   flags = 0;
00538 
00539         memset(cnt, 0, sizeof(*cnt));
00540 
00541         if (stats == NULL) {
00542                 /* set count to 1 to avoid divide-by-zero errs in callers */
00543                 cnt->lc_count = 1;
00544                 return;
00545         }
00546 
00547         cnt->lc_min = LC_MIN_INIT;
00548 
00549         num_entry = lprocfs_stats_lock(stats, LPROCFS_GET_NUM_CPU, &flags);
00550 
00551         for (i = 0; i < num_entry; i++) {
00552                 if (stats->ls_percpu[i] == NULL)
00553                         continue;
00554                 percpu_cntr = lprocfs_stats_counter_get(stats, i, idx);
00555 
00556                 cnt->lc_count += percpu_cntr->lc_count;
00557                 cnt->lc_sum += percpu_cntr->lc_sum;
00558                 if (percpu_cntr->lc_min < cnt->lc_min)
00559                         cnt->lc_min = percpu_cntr->lc_min;
00560                 if (percpu_cntr->lc_max > cnt->lc_max)
00561                         cnt->lc_max = percpu_cntr->lc_max;
00562                 cnt->lc_sumsquare += percpu_cntr->lc_sumsquare;
00563         }
00564 
00565         lprocfs_stats_unlock(stats, LPROCFS_GET_NUM_CPU, &flags);
00566 }
00567 
00571 #define flag2str(flag)                                          \
00572         do {                                                            \
00573                 if (imp->imp_##flag) {                                  \
00574                         seq_printf(m, "%s" #flag, first ? "" : ", ");   \
00575                         first = false;                                  \
00576                 }                                                       \
00577         } while (0)
00578 static void obd_import_flags2str(struct obd_import *imp, struct seq_file *m)
00579 {
00580         bool first = true;
00581 
00582         if (imp->imp_obd->obd_no_recov) {
00583                 seq_printf(m, "no_recov");
00584                 first = false;
00585         }
00586 
00587         flag2str(invalid);
00588         flag2str(deactive);
00589         flag2str(replayable);
00590         flag2str(delayed_recovery);
00591         flag2str(no_lock_replay);
00592         flag2str(vbr_failed);
00593         flag2str(pingable);
00594         flag2str(resend_replay);
00595         flag2str(no_pinger_recover);
00596         flag2str(need_mne_swab);
00597         flag2str(connect_tried);
00598 }
00599 #undef flag2str

00653         "flock_deadlock",
00654         "disp_stripe",
00655         "open_by_fid",
00656         "lfsck",
00657         "unknown",
00658         "unlink_close",
00659         "multi_mod_rpcs",
00660         "dir_stripe",
00661         "subtree",
00662         "lock_ahead",
00663         "bulk_mbits",
00664         "compact_obdo",
00665         "second_flags",
00666         NULL
00667 };
00668 
00669 static void obd_connect_seq_flags2str(struct seq_file *m, __u64 flags, char *sep)
00670 {
00671         bool first = true;
00672         __u64 mask = 1;
00673         int i;
00674 
00675         for (i = 0; obd_connect_names[i] != NULL; i++, mask <<= 1) {
00676                 if (flags & mask) {
00677                         seq_printf(m, "%s%s",
00678                                    first ? "" : sep, obd_connect_names[i]);
00679                         first = false;
00680                 }
00681         }
00682         if (flags & ~(mask - 1))
00683                 seq_printf(m, "%sunknown_"LPX64,
00684                            first ? "" : sep, flags & ~(mask - 1));
00685 }
00686 
00687 int obd_connect_flags2str(char *page, int count, __u64 flags, char *sep)
00688 {
00689         __u64 mask = 1;
00690         int i, ret = 0;
00691 
00692         for (i = 0; obd_connect_names[i] != NULL; i++, mask <<= 1) {
00693                 if (flags & mask)
00694                         ret += snprintf(page + ret, count - ret, "%s%s",
00695                                         ret ? sep : "", obd_connect_names[i]);
00696         }
00697         if (flags & ~(mask - 1))
00698                 ret += snprintf(page + ret, count - ret,
00699                                 "%sunknown_"LPX64,
00700                                 ret ? sep : "", flags & ~(mask - 1));
00701         return ret;
00702 }
00703 EXPORT_SYMBOL(obd_connect_flags2str);
00704 
00705 static void obd_connect_data_seqprint(struct seq_file *m,
00706                                       struct obd_connect_data *ocd)
00707 {
00708         __u64 flags;
00709 
00710         LASSERT(ocd != NULL);
00711         flags = ocd->ocd_connect_flags;
00712 
00713         seq_printf(m, "    connect_data:\n"
00714                    "       flags: "LPX64"\n"
00715                    "       instance: %u\n",
00716                    ocd->ocd_connect_flags,
00717                    ocd->ocd_instance);
00718         if (flags & OBD_CONNECT_VERSION)
00719                 seq_printf(m, "       target_version: %u.%u.%u.%u\n",
00720                            OBD_OCD_VERSION_MAJOR(ocd->ocd_version),
00721                            OBD_OCD_VERSION_MINOR(ocd->ocd_version),
00722                            OBD_OCD_VERSION_PATCH(ocd->ocd_version),
00723                            OBD_OCD_VERSION_FIX(ocd->ocd_version));
00724         if (flags & OBD_CONNECT_MDS)
00725                 seq_printf(m, "       mdt_index: %d\n", ocd->ocd_group);
00726         if (flags & OBD_CONNECT_GRANT)
00727                 seq_printf(m, "       initial_grant: %d\n", ocd->ocd_grant);
00728         if (flags & OBD_CONNECT_INDEX)
00729                 seq_printf(m, "       target_index: %u\n", ocd->ocd_index);
00730         if (flags & OBD_CONNECT_BRW_SIZE)
00731                 seq_printf(m, "       max_brw_size: %d\n", ocd->ocd_brw_size);
00732         if (flags & OBD_CONNECT_IBITS)
00733                 seq_printf(m, "       ibits_known: "LPX64"\n",
00734                            ocd->ocd_ibits_known);
00735         if (flags & OBD_CONNECT_GRANT_PARAM)
00736                 seq_printf(m, "       grant_block_size: %d\n"
00737                            "       grant_inode_size: %d\n"
00738                            "       grant_max_extent_size: %d\n"
00739                            "       grant_extent_tax: %d\n",
00740                            1 << ocd->ocd_grant_blkbits,
00741                            1 << ocd->ocd_grant_inobits,
00742                            ocd->ocd_grant_max_blks << ocd->ocd_grant_blkbits,
00743                            ocd->ocd_grant_tax_kb << 10);
00744         if (flags & OBD_CONNECT_TRANSNO)
00745                 seq_printf(m, "       first_transno: "LPX64"\n",
00746                            ocd->ocd_transno);
00747         if (flags & OBD_CONNECT_CKSUM)
00748                 seq_printf(m, "       cksum_types: %#x\n",
00749                            ocd->ocd_cksum_types);
00750         if (flags & OBD_CONNECT_MAX_EASIZE)
00751                 seq_printf(m, "       max_easize: %d\n", ocd->ocd_max_easize);
00752         if (flags & OBD_CONNECT_MAXBYTES)
00753                 seq_printf(m, "       max_object_bytes: "LPU64"\n",
00754                            ocd->ocd_maxbytes);
00755         if (flags & OBD_CONNECT_MULTIMODRPCS)
00756                 seq_printf(m, "       max_mod_rpcs: %hu\n",
00757                            ocd->ocd_maxmodrpcs);
00758 }
00759 
00760 int lprocfs_import_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *data)
00761 {
00762         char                            nidstr[LNET_NIDSTR_SIZE];
00763         struct lprocfs_counter          ret;
00764         struct lprocfs_counter_header   *header;
00765         struct obd_device               *obd    = (struct obd_device *)data;
00766         struct obd_import               *imp;
00767         struct obd_import_conn          *conn;
00768         struct obd_connect_data         *ocd;
00769         int                             j;
00770         int                             k;
00771         int                             rw      = 0;
00772 
00773         LASSERT(obd != NULL);
00774         LPROCFS_CLIMP_CHECK(obd);
00775         imp = obd->u.cli.cl_import;
00776         ocd = &imp->imp_connect_data;
00777 
00778         seq_printf(m, "import:\n"
00779                    "    name: %s\n"
00780                    "    target: %s\n"
00781                    "    state: %s\n"
00782                    "    connect_flags: [ ",
00783                    obd->obd_name,
00784                    obd2cli_tgt(obd),
00785                    ptlrpc_import_state_name(imp->imp_state));
00786         obd_connect_seq_flags2str(m, imp->imp_connect_data.ocd_connect_flags,
00787                                   ", ");
00788         seq_printf(m, " ]\n");
00789         obd_connect_data_seqprint(m, ocd);
00790         seq_printf(m, "    import_flags: [ ");
00791         obd_import_flags2str(imp, m);
00792 
00793         seq_printf(m, " ]\n"
00794                    "    connection:\n"
00795                    "       failover_nids: [ ");
00796         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
00797         j = 0;
00798         list_for_each_entry(conn, &imp->imp_conn_list, oic_item) {
00799                 libcfs_nid2str_r(conn->oic_conn->c_peer.nid,
00800                                  nidstr, sizeof(nidstr));
00801                 seq_printf(m, "%s%s", j ? ", " : "", nidstr);
00802                 j++;
00803         }
00804         if (imp->imp_connection != NULL)
00805                 libcfs_nid2str_r(imp->imp_connection->c_peer.nid,
00806                                  nidstr, sizeof(nidstr));
00807         else
00808                 strncpy(nidstr, "<none>", sizeof(nidstr));
00809         seq_printf(m, " ]\n"
00810                    "       current_connection: %s\n"
00811                    "       connection_attempts: %u\n"
00812                    "       generation: %u\n"
00813                    "       in-progress_invalidations: %u\n",
00814                    nidstr,
00815                    imp->imp_conn_cnt,
00816                    imp->imp_generation,
00817                    atomic_read(&imp->imp_inval_count));
00818         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00819 
00820         if (obd->obd_svc_stats == NULL)
00821                 goto out_climp;
00822 
00823         header = &obd->obd_svc_stats->ls_cnt_header[PTLRPC_REQWAIT_CNTR];
00824         lprocfs_stats_collect(obd->obd_svc_stats, PTLRPC_REQWAIT_CNTR, &ret);
00825         if (ret.lc_count != 0) {
00826                 /* first argument to do_div MUST be __u64 */
00827                 __u64 sum = ret.lc_sum;
00828                 do_div(sum, ret.lc_count);
00829                 ret.lc_sum = sum;
00830         } else
00831                 ret.lc_sum = 0;
00832         seq_printf(m, "    rpcs:\n"
00833                    "       inflight: %u\n"
00834                    "       unregistering: %u\n"
00835                    "       timeouts: %u\n"
00836                    "       avg_waittime: "LPU64" %s\n",
00837                    atomic_read(&imp->imp_inflight),
00838                    atomic_read(&imp->imp_unregistering),
00839                    atomic_read(&imp->imp_timeouts),
00840                    ret.lc_sum, header->lc_units);
00841 
00842         k = 0;
00843         for(j = 0; j < IMP_AT_MAX_PORTALS; j++) {
00844                 if (imp->imp_at.iat_portal[j] == 0)
00845                         break;
00846                 k = max_t(unsigned int, k,
00847                           at_get(&imp->imp_at.iat_service_estimate[j]));
00848         }
00849         seq_printf(m, "    service_estimates:\n"
00850                    "       services: %u sec\n"
00851                    "       network: %u sec\n",
00852                    k,
00853                    at_get(&imp->imp_at.iat_net_latency));
00854 
00855         seq_printf(m, "    transactions:\n"
00856                    "       last_replay: "LPU64"\n"
00857                    "       peer_committed: "LPU64"\n"
00858                    "       last_checked: "LPU64"\n",
00859                    imp->imp_last_replay_transno,
00860                    imp->imp_peer_committed_transno,
00861                    imp->imp_last_transno_checked);
00862 
00863         /* avg data rates */
00864         for (rw = 0; rw <= 1; rw++) {
00865                 lprocfs_stats_collect(obd->obd_svc_stats,
00866                                       PTLRPC_LAST_CNTR + BRW_READ_BYTES + rw,
00867                                       &ret);
00868                 if (ret.lc_sum > 0 && ret.lc_count > 0) {
00869                         /* first argument to do_div MUST be __u64 */
00870                         __u64 sum = ret.lc_sum;
00871                         do_div(sum, ret.lc_count);
00872                         ret.lc_sum = sum;
00873                         seq_printf(m, "    %s_data_averages:\n"
00874                                    "       bytes_per_rpc: "LPU64"\n",
00875                                    rw ? "write" : "read",
00876                                    ret.lc_sum);
00877                 }
00878                 k = (int)ret.lc_sum;
00879                 j = opcode_offset(OST_READ + rw) + EXTRA_MAX_OPCODES;
00880                 header = &obd->obd_svc_stats->ls_cnt_header[j];
00881                 lprocfs_stats_collect(obd->obd_svc_stats, j, &ret);
00882                 if (ret.lc_sum > 0 && ret.lc_count != 0) {
00883                         /* first argument to do_div MUST be __u64 */
00884                         __u64 sum = ret.lc_sum;
00885                         do_div(sum, ret.lc_count);
00886                         ret.lc_sum = sum;
00887                         seq_printf(m, "       %s_per_rpc: "LPU64"\n",
00888                                    header->lc_units, ret.lc_sum);
00889                         j = (int)ret.lc_sum;
00890                         if (j > 0)
00891                                 seq_printf(m, "       MB_per_sec: %u.%.02u\n",
00892                                            k / j, (100 * k / j) % 100);
00893                 }
00894         }
00895 
00896 out_climp:
00897         LPROCFS_CLIMP_EXIT(obd);
00898         return 0;
00899 }
00900 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_import_seq_show);
00901 
00902 int lprocfs_state_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *data)
00903 {
00904         struct obd_device *obd = (struct obd_device *)data;
00905         struct obd_import *imp;
00906         int j, k;
00907 
00908         LASSERT(obd != NULL);
00909         LPROCFS_CLIMP_CHECK(obd);
00910         imp = obd->u.cli.cl_import;
00911 
00912         seq_printf(m, "current_state: %s\n",
00913                    ptlrpc_import_state_name(imp->imp_state));
00914         seq_printf(m, "state_history:\n");
00915         k = imp->imp_state_hist_idx;
00916         for (j = 0; j < IMP_STATE_HIST_LEN; j++) {
00917                 struct import_state_hist *ish =
00918                         &imp->imp_state_hist[(k + j) % IMP_STATE_HIST_LEN];
00919                 if (ish->ish_state == 0)
00920                         continue;
00921                 seq_printf(m, " - [ "CFS_TIME_T", %s ]\n",
00922                            ish->ish_time,
00923                 ptlrpc_import_state_name(ish->ish_state));
00924         }
00925 
00926         LPROCFS_CLIMP_EXIT(obd);
00927         return 0;
00928 }
00929 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_state_seq_show);
00930 
00931 int lprocfs_at_hist_helper(struct seq_file *m, struct adaptive_timeout *at)
00932 {
00933         int i;
00934         for (i = 0; i < AT_BINS; i++)
00935                 seq_printf(m, "%3u ", at->at_hist[i]);
00936         seq_printf(m, "\n");
00937         return 0;
00938 }
00939 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_at_hist_helper);
00940 
00941 /* See also ptlrpc_lprocfs_timeouts_show_seq */
00942 int lprocfs_timeouts_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *data)
00943 {
00944         struct obd_device *obd = (struct obd_device *)data;
00945         struct obd_import *imp;
00946         unsigned int cur, worst;
00947         time_t now, worstt;
00948         struct dhms ts;
00949         int i;
00950 
00951         LASSERT(obd != NULL);
00952         LPROCFS_CLIMP_CHECK(obd);
00953         imp = obd->u.cli.cl_import;
00954 
00955         now = cfs_time_current_sec();
00956 
00957         /* Some network health info for kicks */
00958         s2dhms(&ts, now - imp->imp_last_reply_time);
00959         seq_printf(m, "%-10s : %ld, "DHMS_FMT" ago\n",
00960                    "last reply", imp->imp_last_reply_time, DHMS_VARS(&ts));
00961 
00962         cur = at_get(&imp->imp_at.iat_net_latency);
00963         worst = imp->imp_at.iat_net_latency.at_worst_ever;
00964         worstt = imp->imp_at.iat_net_latency.at_worst_time;
00965         s2dhms(&ts, now - worstt);
00966         seq_printf(m, "%-10s : cur %3u  worst %3u (at %ld, "DHMS_FMT" ago) ",
00967                    "network", cur, worst, worstt, DHMS_VARS(&ts));
00968         lprocfs_at_hist_helper(m, &imp->imp_at.iat_net_latency);
00969 
00970         for(i = 0; i < IMP_AT_MAX_PORTALS; i++) {
00971                 if (imp->imp_at.iat_portal[i] == 0)
00972                         break;
00973                 cur = at_get(&imp->imp_at.iat_service_estimate[i]);
00974                 worst = imp->imp_at.iat_service_estimate[i].at_worst_ever;
00975                 worstt = imp->imp_at.iat_service_estimate[i].at_worst_time;
00976                 s2dhms(&ts, now - worstt);
00977                 seq_printf(m, "portal %-2d  : cur %3u  worst %3u (at %ld, "
00978                            DHMS_FMT" ago) ", imp->imp_at.iat_portal[i],
00979                            cur, worst, worstt, DHMS_VARS(&ts));
00980                 lprocfs_at_hist_helper(m, &imp->imp_at.iat_service_estimate[i]);
00981         }
00982 
00983         LPROCFS_CLIMP_EXIT(obd);
00984         return 0;
00985 }
00986 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_timeouts_seq_show);
00987 
00988 int lprocfs_connect_flags_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *data)
00989 {
00990         struct obd_device *obd = data;
00991         __u64 flags;
00992 
00993         LPROCFS_CLIMP_CHECK(obd);
00994         flags = obd->u.cli.cl_import->imp_connect_data.ocd_connect_flags;
00995         seq_printf(m, "flags="LPX64"\n", flags);
00996         obd_connect_seq_flags2str(m, flags, "\n");
00997         seq_printf(m, "\n");
00998         LPROCFS_CLIMP_EXIT(obd);
00999         return 0;
01000 }
01001 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_connect_flags_seq_show);
01002 
01003 int
01004 lprocfs_obd_setup(struct obd_device *obd)
01005 {
01006         int rc = 0;
01007 
01008         LASSERT(obd != NULL);
01009         LASSERT(obd->obd_magic == OBD_DEVICE_MAGIC);
01010         LASSERT(obd->obd_type->typ_procroot != NULL);
01011 
01012         obd->obd_proc_entry = lprocfs_register(obd->obd_name,
01013                                                obd->obd_type->typ_procroot,
01014                                                obd->obd_vars, obd);
01015         if (IS_ERR(obd->obd_proc_entry)) {
01016                 rc = PTR_ERR(obd->obd_proc_entry);
01017                 CERROR("error %d setting up lprocfs for %s\n",rc,obd->obd_name);
01018                 obd->obd_proc_entry = NULL;
01019         }
01020         return rc;
01021 }
01022 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_obd_setup);
01023 
01024 int lprocfs_obd_cleanup(struct obd_device *obd)
01025 {
01026         if (!obd)
01027                 return -EINVAL;
01028         if (obd->obd_proc_exports_entry) {
01029                 /* Should be no exports left */
01030                 lprocfs_remove(&obd->obd_proc_exports_entry);
01031                 obd->obd_proc_exports_entry = NULL;
01032         }
01033         if (obd->obd_proc_entry) {
01034                 lprocfs_remove(&obd->obd_proc_entry);
01035                 obd->obd_proc_entry = NULL;
01036         }
01037         return 0;
01038 }
01039 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_obd_cleanup);
01040 
01041 int lprocfs_stats_alloc_one(struct lprocfs_stats *stats, unsigned int cpuid)
01042 {
01043         struct lprocfs_counter  *cntr;
01044         unsigned int            percpusize;
01045         int                     rc = -ENOMEM;
01046         unsigned long           flags = 0;
01047         int                     i;
01048 
01049         LASSERT(stats->ls_percpu[cpuid] == NULL);
01050         LASSERT((stats->ls_flags & LPROCFS_STATS_FLAG_NOPERCPU) == 0);
01051 
01052         percpusize = lprocfs_stats_counter_size(stats);
01053         LIBCFS_ALLOC_ATOMIC(stats->ls_percpu[cpuid], percpusize);
01054         if (stats->ls_percpu[cpuid] != NULL) {
01055                 rc = 0;
01056                 if (unlikely(stats->ls_biggest_alloc_num <= cpuid)) {
01057                         if (stats->ls_flags & LPROCFS_STATS_FLAG_IRQ_SAFE)
01058                                 spin_lock_irqsave(&stats->ls_lock, flags);
01059                         else
01060                                 spin_lock(&stats->ls_lock);
01061                         if (stats->ls_biggest_alloc_num <= cpuid)
01062                                 stats->ls_biggest_alloc_num = cpuid + 1;
01063                         if (stats->ls_flags & LPROCFS_STATS_FLAG_IRQ_SAFE) {
01064                                 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&stats->ls_lock, flags);
01065                         } else {
01066                                 spin_unlock(&stats->ls_lock);
01067                         }
01068                 }
01069                 /* initialize the ls_percpu[cpuid] non-zero counter */
01070                 for (i = 0; i < stats->ls_num; ++i) {
01071                         cntr = lprocfs_stats_counter_get(stats, cpuid, i);
01072                         cntr->lc_min = LC_MIN_INIT;
01073                 }
01074         }
01075         return rc;
01076 }
01077 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_stats_alloc_one);
01078 
01079 struct lprocfs_stats *lprocfs_alloc_stats(unsigned int num,
01080                                           enum lprocfs_stats_flags flags)
01081 {
01082         struct lprocfs_stats    *stats;
01083         unsigned int            num_entry;
01084         unsigned int            percpusize = 0;
01085         int                     i;
01086 
01087         if (num == 0)
01088                 return NULL;
01089 
01090         if (lprocfs_no_percpu_stats != 0)
01091                 flags |= LPROCFS_STATS_FLAG_NOPERCPU;
01092 
01093         if (flags & LPROCFS_STATS_FLAG_NOPERCPU)
01094                 num_entry = 1;
01095         else
01096                 num_entry = num_possible_cpus();
01097 
01098         /* alloc percpu pointers for all possible cpu slots */
01099         LIBCFS_ALLOC(stats, offsetof(typeof(*stats), ls_percpu[num_entry]));
01100         if (stats == NULL)
01101                 return NULL;
01102 
01103         stats->ls_num = num;
01104         stats->ls_flags = flags;
01105         spin_lock_init(&stats->ls_lock);
01106 
01107         /* alloc num of counter headers */
01108         LIBCFS_ALLOC(stats->ls_cnt_header,
01109                      stats->ls_num * sizeof(struct lprocfs_counter_header));
01110         if (stats->ls_cnt_header == NULL)
01111                 goto fail;
01112 
01113         if ((flags & LPROCFS_STATS_FLAG_NOPERCPU) != 0) {
01114                 /* contains only one set counters */
01115                 percpusize = lprocfs_stats_counter_size(stats);
01116                 LIBCFS_ALLOC_ATOMIC(stats->ls_percpu[0], percpusize);
01117                 if (stats->ls_percpu[0] == NULL)
01118                         goto fail;
01119                 stats->ls_biggest_alloc_num = 1;
01120         } else if ((flags & LPROCFS_STATS_FLAG_IRQ_SAFE) != 0) {
01121                 /* alloc all percpu data, currently only obd_memory use this */
01122                 for (i = 0; i < num_entry; ++i)
01123                         if (lprocfs_stats_alloc_one(stats, i) < 0)
01124                                 goto fail;
01125         }
01126 
01127         return stats;
01128 
01129 fail:
01130         lprocfs_free_stats(&stats);
01131         return NULL;
01132 }
01133 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_alloc_stats);
01134 
01135 void lprocfs_free_stats(struct lprocfs_stats **statsh)
01136 {
01137         struct lprocfs_stats *stats = *statsh;
01138         unsigned int num_entry;
01139         unsigned int percpusize;
01140         unsigned int i;
01141 
01142         if (stats == NULL || stats->ls_num == 0)
01143                 return;
01144         *statsh = NULL;
01145 
01146         if (stats->ls_flags & LPROCFS_STATS_FLAG_NOPERCPU)
01147                 num_entry = 1;
01148         else
01149                 num_entry = num_possible_cpus();
01150 
01151         percpusize = lprocfs_stats_counter_size(stats);
01152         for (i = 0; i < num_entry; i++)
01153                 if (stats->ls_percpu[i] != NULL)
01154                         LIBCFS_FREE(stats->ls_percpu[i], percpusize);
01155         if (stats->ls_cnt_header != NULL)
01156                 LIBCFS_FREE(stats->ls_cnt_header, stats->ls_num *
01157                                         sizeof(struct lprocfs_counter_header));
01158         LIBCFS_FREE(stats, offsetof(typeof(*stats), ls_percpu[num_entry]));
01159 }
01160 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_free_stats);
01161 
01162 void lprocfs_clear_stats(struct lprocfs_stats *stats)
01163 {
01164         struct lprocfs_counter          *percpu_cntr;
01165         int                             i;
01166         int                             j;
01167         unsigned int                    num_entry;
01168         unsigned long                   flags = 0;
01169 
01170         num_entry = lprocfs_stats_lock(stats, LPROCFS_GET_NUM_CPU, &flags);
01171 
01172         for (i = 0; i < num_entry; i++) {
01173                 if (stats->ls_percpu[i] == NULL)
01174                         continue;
01175                 for (j = 0; j < stats->ls_num; j++) {
01176                         percpu_cntr = lprocfs_stats_counter_get(stats, i, j);
01177                         percpu_cntr->lc_count           = 0;
01178                         percpu_cntr->lc_min             = LC_MIN_INIT;
01179                         percpu_cntr->lc_max             = 0;
01180                         percpu_cntr->lc_sumsquare       = 0;
01181                         percpu_cntr->lc_sum             = 0;
01182                         if (stats->ls_flags & LPROCFS_STATS_FLAG_IRQ_SAFE)
01183                                 percpu_cntr->lc_sum_irq = 0;
01184                 }
01185         }
01186 
01187         lprocfs_stats_unlock(stats, LPROCFS_GET_NUM_CPU, &flags);
01188 }
01189 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_clear_stats);
01190 
01191 static ssize_t lprocfs_stats_seq_write(struct file *file,
01192                                        const char __user *buf,
01193                                        size_t len, loff_t *off)
01194 {
01195         struct seq_file *seq = file->private_data;
01196         struct lprocfs_stats *stats = seq->private;
01197 
01198         lprocfs_clear_stats(stats);
01199 
01200         return len;
01201 }
01202 
01203 static void *lprocfs_stats_seq_start(struct seq_file *p, loff_t *pos)
01204 {
01205         struct lprocfs_stats *stats = p->private;
01206 
01207         return (*pos < stats->ls_num) ? pos : NULL;
01208 }
01209 
01210 static void lprocfs_stats_seq_stop(struct seq_file *p, void *v)
01211 {
01212 }
01213 
01214 static void *lprocfs_stats_seq_next(struct seq_file *p, void *v, loff_t *pos)
01215 {
01216         (*pos)++;
01217 
01218         return lprocfs_stats_seq_start(p, pos);
01219 }
01220 
01221 /* seq file export of one lprocfs counter */
01222 static int lprocfs_stats_seq_show(struct seq_file *p, void *v)
01223 {
01224         struct lprocfs_stats            *stats  = p->private;
01225         struct lprocfs_counter_header   *hdr;
01226         struct lprocfs_counter           ctr;
01227         int                              idx    = *(loff_t *)v;
01228         int                              rc     = 0;
01229 
01230         if (idx == 0) {
01231                 struct timeval now;
01232 
01233                 do_gettimeofday(&now);
01234                 seq_printf(p, "%-25s %lu.%lu secs.usecs\n",
01235                            "snapshot_time", now.tv_sec, now.tv_usec);
01236                 if (rc < 0)
01237                         return rc;
01238         }
01239 
01240         hdr = &stats->ls_cnt_header[idx];
01241         lprocfs_stats_collect(stats, idx, &ctr);
01242 
01243         if (ctr.lc_count == 0)
01244                 goto out;
01245 
01246         seq_printf(p, "%-25s "LPD64" samples [%s]", hdr->lc_name,
01247                    ctr.lc_count, hdr->lc_units);
01248         if (rc < 0)
01249                 goto out;
01250 
01251         if ((hdr->lc_config & LPROCFS_CNTR_AVGMINMAX) && ctr.lc_count > 0) {
01252                 seq_printf(p, " "LPD64" "LPD64" "LPD64,
01253                            ctr.lc_min, ctr.lc_max, ctr.lc_sum);
01254                 if (rc < 0)
01255                         goto out;
01256                 if (hdr->lc_config & LPROCFS_CNTR_STDDEV)
01257                         seq_printf(p, " "LPD64, ctr.lc_sumsquare);
01258                 if (rc < 0)
01259                         goto out;
01260         }
01261         seq_putc(p, '\n');
01262 out:
01263         return (rc < 0) ? rc : 0;
01264 }
01265 
01266 static const struct seq_operations lprocfs_stats_seq_sops = {
01267         .start  = lprocfs_stats_seq_start,
01268         .stop   = lprocfs_stats_seq_stop,
01269         .next   = lprocfs_stats_seq_next,
01270         .show   = lprocfs_stats_seq_show,
01271 };
01272 
01273 static int lprocfs_stats_seq_open(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
01274 {
01275         struct seq_file *seq;
01276         int rc;
01277 
01278         rc = LPROCFS_ENTRY_CHECK(inode);
01279         if (rc < 0)
01280                 return rc;
01281 
01282         rc = seq_open(file, &lprocfs_stats_seq_sops);
01283         if (rc)
01284                 return rc;
01285         seq = file->private_data;
01286         seq->private = PDE_DATA(inode);
01287         return 0;
01288 }
01289 
01290 static const struct file_operations lprocfs_stats_seq_fops = {
01291         .owner   = THIS_MODULE,
01292         .open    = lprocfs_stats_seq_open,
01293         .read    = seq_read,
01294         .write   = lprocfs_stats_seq_write,
01295         .llseek  = seq_lseek,
01296         .release = lprocfs_seq_release,
01297 };
01298 
01299 int lprocfs_register_stats(struct proc_dir_entry *root, const char *name,
01300                            struct lprocfs_stats *stats)
01301 {
01302         struct proc_dir_entry *entry;
01303         LASSERT(root != NULL);
01304 
01305         entry = proc_create_data(name, 0644, root,
01306                                  &lprocfs_stats_seq_fops, stats);
01307         if (entry == NULL)
01308                 return -ENOMEM;
01309         return 0;
01310 }
01311 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_register_stats);
01312 
01313 void lprocfs_counter_init(struct lprocfs_stats *stats, int index,
01314                           unsigned conf, const char *name, const char *units)
01315 {
01316         struct lprocfs_counter_header   *header;
01317         struct lprocfs_counter          *percpu_cntr;
01318         unsigned long                   flags = 0;
01319         unsigned int                    i;
01320         unsigned int                    num_cpu;
01321 
01322         LASSERT(stats != NULL);
01323 
01324         header = &stats->ls_cnt_header[index];
01325         LASSERTF(header != NULL, "Failed to allocate stats header:[%d]%s/%s\n",
01326                  index, name, units);
01327 
01328         header->lc_config = conf;
01329         header->lc_name   = name;
01330         header->lc_units  = units;
01331 
01332         num_cpu = lprocfs_stats_lock(stats, LPROCFS_GET_NUM_CPU, &flags);
01333         for (i = 0; i < num_cpu; ++i) {
01334                 if (stats->ls_percpu[i] == NULL)
01335                         continue;
01336                 percpu_cntr = lprocfs_stats_counter_get(stats, i, index);
01337                 percpu_cntr->lc_count           = 0;
01338                 percpu_cntr->lc_min             = LC_MIN_INIT;
01339                 percpu_cntr->lc_max             = 0;
01340                 percpu_cntr->lc_sumsquare       = 0;
01341                 percpu_cntr->lc_sum             = 0;
01342                 if ((stats->ls_flags & LPROCFS_STATS_FLAG_IRQ_SAFE) != 0)
01343                         percpu_cntr->lc_sum_irq = 0;
01344         }
01345         lprocfs_stats_unlock(stats, LPROCFS_GET_NUM_CPU, &flags);
01346 }
01347 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_counter_init);
01348 
01349 /* Note that we only init md counters for ops whose offset is less
01350  * than NUM_MD_STATS. This is explained in a comment in the definition
01351  * of struct md_ops. */
01352 #define LPROCFS_MD_OP_INIT(base, stats, op)                                    \
01353         do {                                                                   \
01354                 unsigned int _idx = base + MD_COUNTER_OFFSET(op);              \
01355                                                                                \
01356                 if (MD_COUNTER_OFFSET(op) < NUM_MD_STATS) {                    \
01357                         LASSERT(_idx < stats->ls_num);                         \
01358                         lprocfs_counter_init(stats, _idx, 0, #op, "reqs");     \
01359                 }                                                              \
01360         } while (0)
01361 
01362 void lprocfs_init_mps_stats(int num_private_stats, struct lprocfs_stats *stats)
01363 {
01364         LPROCFS_MD_OP_INIT(num_private_stats, stats, get_root);
01365         LPROCFS_MD_OP_INIT(num_private_stats, stats, null_inode);
01366         LPROCFS_MD_OP_INIT(num_private_stats, stats, close);
01367         LPROCFS_MD_OP_INIT(num_private_stats, stats, create);
01368         LPROCFS_MD_OP_INIT(num_private_stats, stats, enqueue);
01369         LPROCFS_MD_OP_INIT(num_private_stats, stats, getattr);
01370         LPROCFS_MD_OP_INIT(num_private_stats, stats, getattr_name);
01371         LPROCFS_MD_OP_INIT(num_private_stats, stats, intent_lock);
01372         LPROCFS_MD_OP_INIT(num_private_stats, stats, link);
01373         LPROCFS_MD_OP_INIT(num_private_stats, stats, rename);
01374         LPROCFS_MD_OP_INIT(num_private_stats, stats, setattr);
01375         LPROCFS_MD_OP_INIT(num_private_stats, stats, fsync);
01376         LPROCFS_MD_OP_INIT(num_private_stats, stats, read_page);
01377         LPROCFS_MD_OP_INIT(num_private_stats, stats, unlink);
01378         LPROCFS_MD_OP_INIT(num_private_stats, stats, setxattr);
01379         LPROCFS_MD_OP_INIT(num_private_stats, stats, getxattr);
01380         LPROCFS_MD_OP_INIT(num_private_stats, stats, init_ea_size);
01381         LPROCFS_MD_OP_INIT(num_private_stats, stats, get_lustre_md);
01382         LPROCFS_MD_OP_INIT(num_private_stats, stats, free_lustre_md);
01383         LPROCFS_MD_OP_INIT(num_private_stats, stats, merge_attr);
01384         LPROCFS_MD_OP_INIT(num_private_stats, stats, set_open_replay_data);
01385         LPROCFS_MD_OP_INIT(num_private_stats, stats, clear_open_replay_data);
01386         LPROCFS_MD_OP_INIT(num_private_stats, stats, set_lock_data);
01387         LPROCFS_MD_OP_INIT(num_private_stats, stats, lock_match);
01388         LPROCFS_MD_OP_INIT(num_private_stats, stats, cancel_unused);
01389         LPROCFS_MD_OP_INIT(num_private_stats, stats, get_remote_perm);
01390         LPROCFS_MD_OP_INIT(num_private_stats, stats, intent_getattr_async);
01391         LPROCFS_MD_OP_INIT(num_private_stats, stats, revalidate_lock);
01392 }
01393 
01394 int lprocfs_alloc_md_stats(struct obd_device *obd,
01395                            unsigned int num_private_stats)
01396 {
01397         struct lprocfs_stats *stats;
01398         unsigned int num_stats;
01399         int rc, i;
01400 
01401         CLASSERT(offsetof(struct md_ops, MD_STATS_FIRST_OP) == 0);
01402         CLASSERT(_MD_COUNTER_OFFSET(MD_STATS_FIRST_OP) == 0);
01403         CLASSERT(_MD_COUNTER_OFFSET(MD_STATS_LAST_OP) > 0);
01404 
01405         /* TODO Ensure that this function is only used where
01406          * appropriate by adding an assertion to the effect that
01407          * obd->obd_type->typ_md_ops is not NULL. We can't do this now
01408          * because mdt_procfs_init() uses this function to allocate
01409          * the stats backing /proc/fs/lustre/mdt/.../md_stats but the
01410          * mdt layer does not use the md_ops interface. This is
01411          * confusing and a waste of memory. See LU-2484.
01412          */
01413         LASSERT(obd->obd_proc_entry != NULL);
01414         LASSERT(obd->obd_md_stats == NULL);
01415         LASSERT(obd->obd_md_cntr_base == 0);
01416 
01417         num_stats = NUM_MD_STATS + num_private_stats;
01418         stats = lprocfs_alloc_stats(num_stats, 0);
01419         if (stats == NULL)
01420                 return -ENOMEM;
01421 
01422         lprocfs_init_mps_stats(num_private_stats, stats);
01423 
01424         for (i = num_private_stats; i < num_stats; i++) {
01425                 if (stats->ls_cnt_header[i].lc_name == NULL) {
01426                         CERROR("Missing md_stat initializer md_op "
01427                                "operation at offset %d. Aborting.\n",
01428                                i - num_private_stats);
01429                         LBUG();
01430                 }
01431         }
01432 
01433         rc = lprocfs_register_stats(obd->obd_proc_entry, "md_stats", stats);
01434         if (rc < 0) {
01435                 lprocfs_free_stats(&stats);
01436         } else {
01437                 obd->obd_md_stats = stats;
01438                 obd->obd_md_cntr_base = num_private_stats;
01439         }
01440 
01441         return rc;
01442 }
01443 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_alloc_md_stats);
01444 
01445 void lprocfs_free_md_stats(struct obd_device *obd)
01446 {
01447         struct lprocfs_stats *stats = obd->obd_md_stats;
01448 
01449         if (stats != NULL) {
01450                 obd->obd_md_stats = NULL;
01451                 obd->obd_md_cntr_base = 0;
01452                 lprocfs_free_stats(&stats);
01453         }
01454 }
01455 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_free_md_stats);
01456 
01457 void lprocfs_init_ldlm_stats(struct lprocfs_stats *ldlm_stats)
01458 {
01459         lprocfs_counter_init(ldlm_stats,
01460                              LDLM_ENQUEUE - LDLM_FIRST_OPC,
01461                              0, "ldlm_enqueue", "reqs");
01462         lprocfs_counter_init(ldlm_stats,
01463                              LDLM_CONVERT - LDLM_FIRST_OPC,
01464                              0, "ldlm_convert", "reqs");
01465         lprocfs_counter_init(ldlm_stats,
01466                              LDLM_CANCEL - LDLM_FIRST_OPC,
01467                              0, "ldlm_cancel", "reqs");
01468         lprocfs_counter_init(ldlm_stats,
01469                              LDLM_BL_CALLBACK - LDLM_FIRST_OPC,
01470                              0, "ldlm_bl_callback", "reqs");
01471         lprocfs_counter_init(ldlm_stats,
01472                              LDLM_CP_CALLBACK - LDLM_FIRST_OPC,
01473                              0, "ldlm_cp_callback", "reqs");
01474         lprocfs_counter_init(ldlm_stats,
01475                              LDLM_GL_CALLBACK - LDLM_FIRST_OPC,
01476                              0, "ldlm_gl_callback", "reqs");
01477 }
01478 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_init_ldlm_stats);
01479 
01480 __s64 lprocfs_read_helper(struct lprocfs_counter *lc,
01481                           struct lprocfs_counter_header *header,
01482                           enum lprocfs_stats_flags flags,
01483                           enum lprocfs_fields_flags field)
01484 {
01485         __s64 ret = 0;
01486 
01487         if (lc == NULL || header == NULL)
01488                 RETURN(0);
01489 
01490         switch (field) {
01491                 case LPROCFS_FIELDS_FLAGS_CONFIG:
01492                         ret = header->lc_config;
01493                         break;
01494                 case LPROCFS_FIELDS_FLAGS_SUM:
01495                         ret = lc->lc_sum;
01496                         if ((flags & LPROCFS_STATS_FLAG_IRQ_SAFE) != 0)
01497                                 ret += lc->lc_sum_irq;
01498                         break;
01499                 case LPROCFS_FIELDS_FLAGS_MIN:
01500                         ret = lc->lc_min;
01501                         break;
01502                 case LPROCFS_FIELDS_FLAGS_MAX:
01503                         ret = lc->lc_max;
01504                         break;
01505                 case LPROCFS_FIELDS_FLAGS_AVG:
01506                         ret = (lc->lc_max - lc->lc_min) / 2;
01507                         break;
01508                 case LPROCFS_FIELDS_FLAGS_SUMSQUARE:
01509                         ret = lc->lc_sumsquare;
01510                         break;
01511                 case LPROCFS_FIELDS_FLAGS_COUNT:
01512                         ret = lc->lc_count;
01513                         break;
01514                 default:
01515                         break;
01516         };
01517         RETURN(ret);
01518 }
01519 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_read_helper);
01520 
01521 int lprocfs_read_frac_helper(char *buffer, unsigned long count, long val,
01522                              int mult)
01523 {
01524         long decimal_val, frac_val;
01525         int prtn;
01526 
01527         if (count < 10)
01528                 return -EINVAL;
01529 
01530         decimal_val = val / mult;
01531         prtn = snprintf(buffer, count, "%ld", decimal_val);
01532         frac_val = val % mult;
01533 
01534         if (prtn < (count - 4) && frac_val > 0) {
01535                 long temp_frac;
01536                 int i, temp_mult = 1, frac_bits = 0;
01537 
01538                 temp_frac = frac_val * 10;
01539                 buffer[prtn++] = '.';
01540                 while (frac_bits < 2 && (temp_frac / mult) < 1 ) {
01541                         /* only reserved 2 bits fraction */
01542                         buffer[prtn++] ='0';
01543                         temp_frac *= 10;
01544                         frac_bits++;
01545                 }
01546                 /*
01547                  * Need to think these cases :
01548                  *      1. #echo x.00 > /proc/xxx       output result : x
01549                  *      2. #echo x.0x > /proc/xxx       output result : x.0x
01550                  *      3. #echo x.x0 > /proc/xxx       output result : x.x
01551                  *      4. #echo x.xx > /proc/xxx       output result : x.xx
01552                  *      Only reserved 2 bits fraction.
01553                  */
01554                 for (i = 0; i < (5 - prtn); i++)
01555                         temp_mult *= 10;
01556 
01557                 frac_bits = min((int)count - prtn, 3 - frac_bits);
01558                 prtn += snprintf(buffer + prtn, frac_bits, "%ld",
01559                                  frac_val * temp_mult / mult);
01560 
01561                 prtn--;
01562                 while(buffer[prtn] < '1' || buffer[prtn] > '9') {
01563                         prtn--;
01564                         if (buffer[prtn] == '.') {
01565                                 prtn--;
01566                                 break;
01567                         }
01568                 }
01569                 prtn++;
01570         }
01571         buffer[prtn++] ='\n';
01572         return prtn;
01573 }
01574 
01575 int lprocfs_seq_read_frac_helper(struct seq_file *m, long val, int mult)
01576 {
01577         long decimal_val, frac_val;
01578 
01579         decimal_val = val / mult;
01580         seq_printf(m, "%ld", decimal_val);
01581         frac_val = val % mult;
01582 
01583         if (frac_val > 0) {
01584                 frac_val *= 100;
01585                 frac_val /= mult;
01586         }
01587         if (frac_val > 0) {
01588                 /* Three cases: x0, xx, 0x */
01589                 if ((frac_val % 10) != 0)
01590                         seq_printf(m, ".%ld", frac_val);
01591                 else
01592                         seq_printf(m, ".%ld", frac_val / 10);
01593         }
01594 
01595         seq_printf(m, "\n");
01596         return 0;
01597 }
01598 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_seq_read_frac_helper);
01599 
01600 /* Obtains the conversion factor for the unit specified */
01601 static int get_mult(char unit, __u64 *mult)
01602 {
01603         __u64 units = 1;
01604 
01605         switch (unit) {
01606         /* peta, tera, giga, mega, and kilo */
01607         case 'p':
01608         case 'P':
01609                 units <<= 10;
01610         case 't':
01611         case 'T':
01612                 units <<= 10;
01613         case 'g':
01614         case 'G':
01615                 units <<= 10;
01616         case 'm':
01617         case 'M':
01618                 units <<= 10;
01619         case 'k':
01620         case 'K':
01621                 units <<= 10;
01622                 break;
01623         /* some tests expect % to be accepted */
01624         case '%':
01625                 units = 1;
01626                 break;
01627         default:
01628                 return -EINVAL;
01629         }
01630 
01631         *mult = units;
01632 
01633         return 0;
01634 }
01635 
01636 /*
01637  * Ensures the numeric string is valid. The function provides the final
01638  * multiplier in the case a unit exists at the end of the string. It also
01639  * locates the start of the whole and fractional parts (if any). This
01640  * function modifies the string so kstrtoull can be used to parse both
01641  * the whole and fraction portions. This function also figures out
01642  * the base of the number.
01643  */
01644 static int preprocess_numeric_str(char *buffer, __u64 *mult, __u64 def_mult,
01645                                   bool allow_units, char **whole, char **frac,
01646                                   unsigned int *base)
01647 {
01648         bool hit_decimal = false;
01649         bool hit_unit = false;
01650         int rc = 0;
01651         char *start;
01652         *mult = def_mult;
01653         *whole = NULL;
01654         *frac = NULL;
01655         *base = 10;
01656 
01657         /* a hex string if it starts with "0x" */
01658         if (buffer[0] == '0' && tolower(buffer[1]) == 'x') {
01659                 *base = 16;
01660                 buffer += 2;
01661         }
01662 
01663         start = buffer;
01664 
01665         while (*buffer) {
01666                 /* any chars after our unit indicates a malformed string */
01667                 if (hit_unit)
01668                         return -EINVAL;
01669 
01670                 /* ensure we only hit one decimal */
01671                 if (*buffer == '.') {
01672                         if (hit_decimal)
01673                                 return -EINVAL;
01674 
01675                         /* if past start, there's a whole part */
01676                         if (start != buffer)
01677                                 *whole = start;
01678 
01679                         *buffer = '\0';
01680                         start = buffer + 1;
01681                         hit_decimal = true;
01682                 } else if (!isdigit(*buffer) &&
01683                            !(*base == 16 && isxdigit(*buffer))) {
01684                         if (allow_units) {
01685                                 /* if we allow units, attempt to get mult */
01686                                 hit_unit = true;
01687                                 rc = get_mult(*buffer, mult);
01688                                 if (rc)
01689                                         return rc;
01690 
01691                                 /* string stops here, but keep processing */
01692                                 *buffer = '\0';
01693                         } else {
01694                                 /* bad string */
01695                                 return -EINVAL;
01696                         }
01697                 }
01698 
01699                 buffer++;
01700         }
01701 
01702         if (hit_decimal) {
01703                 /* hit a decimal, make sure there's a fractional part */
01704                 if (!*start)
01705                         return -EINVAL;
01706 
01707                 *frac = start;
01708         } else {
01709                 /* didn't hit a decimal, but may have a whole part */
01710                 if (start != buffer && *start)
01711                         *whole = start;
01712         }
01713 
01714         /* malformed string if we didn't get anything */
01715         if (!*frac && !*whole)
01716                 return -EINVAL;
01717 
01718         return 0;
01719 }
01720 
01721 /*
01722  * Parses a numeric string which can contain a whole and fraction portion
01723  * into a __u64. Accepts a multiplier to apply to the value parsed. Also
01724  * allows the string to have a unit at the end. The function handles
01725  * wrapping of the final unsigned value.
01726  */
01727 static int str_to_u64_parse(char *buffer, unsigned long count,
01728                             __u64 *val, __u64 def_mult, bool allow_units)
01729 {
01730         __u64 whole = 0;
01731         __u64 frac = 0;
01732         unsigned int frac_d = 1;
01733         __u64 wrap_indicator = ULLONG_MAX;
01734         int rc = 0;
01735         __u64 mult;
01736         char *strwhole;
01737         char *strfrac;
01738         unsigned int base = 10;
01739 
01740         rc = preprocess_numeric_str(buffer, &mult, def_mult, allow_units,
01741                                     &strwhole, &strfrac, &base);
01742 
01743         if (rc)
01744                 return rc;
01745 
01746         if (mult == 0) {
01747                 *val = 0;
01748                 return 0;
01749         }
01750 
01751         /* the multiplier limits how large the value can be */
01752         wrap_indicator /=  mult;
01753 
01754         if (strwhole) {
01755                 rc = kstrtoull(strwhole, base, &whole);
01756                 if (rc)
01757                         return rc;
01758 
01759                 if (whole > wrap_indicator)
01760                         return -ERANGE;
01761 
01762                 whole *= mult;
01763         }
01764 
01765         if (strfrac) {
01766                 if (strlen(strfrac) > 10)
01767                         strfrac[10] = '\0';
01768 
01769                 rc = kstrtoull(strfrac, base, &frac);
01770                 if (rc)
01771                         return rc;
01772 
01773                 /* determine power of fractional portion */
01774                 while (*strfrac) {
01775                         frac_d *= base;
01776                         strfrac++;
01777                 }
01778 
01779                 /* fractional portion is too large to perform calculation */
01780                 if (frac > wrap_indicator)
01781                         return -ERANGE;
01782 
01783                 frac *= mult;
01784                 do_div(frac, frac_d);
01785         }
01786 
01787         /* check that the sum of whole and fraction fits in u64 */
01788         if (whole > (ULLONG_MAX - frac))
01789                 return -ERANGE;
01790 
01791         *val = whole + frac;
01792 
01793         return 0;
01794 }
01795 
01796 /*
01797  * This function parses numeric/hex strings into __s64. It accepts a multiplier
01798  * which will apply to the value parsed. It also can allow the string to
01799  * have a unit as the last character. The function handles overflow/underflow
01800  * of the signed integer.
01801  */
01802 static int str_to_s64_internal(const char __user *buffer, unsigned long count,
01803                                __s64 *val, __u64 def_mult, bool allow_units)
01804 {
01805         char kernbuf[22];
01806         __u64 tmp;
01807         unsigned int offset = 0;
01808         int signed sign = 1;
01809         __u64 max = LLONG_MAX;
01810         int rc = 0;
01811 
01812         if (count > (sizeof(kernbuf) - 1))
01813                 return -EINVAL;
01814 
01815         if (copy_from_user(kernbuf, buffer, count))
01816                 return -EFAULT;
01817 
01818         kernbuf[count] = '\0';
01819 
01820         /* keep track of our sign */
01821         if (*kernbuf == '-') {
01822                 sign = -1;
01823                 offset++;
01824                 /* equivalent to max = -LLONG_MIN, avoids overflow */
01825                 max++;
01826         }
01827 
01828         rc = str_to_u64_parse(kernbuf + offset, count - offset,
01829                               &tmp, def_mult, allow_units);
01830         if (rc)
01831                 return rc;
01832 
01833         /* check for overflow/underflow */
01834         if (max < tmp)
01835                 return -ERANGE;
01836 
01837         *val = (__s64)tmp * sign;
01838 
01839         return 0;
01840 }
01841 
01855 int lprocfs_str_to_s64(const char __user *buffer, unsigned long count,
01856                        __s64 *val)
01857 {
01858         return str_to_s64_internal(buffer, count, val, 1, false);
01859 }
01860 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_str_to_s64);
01861 
01879 int lprocfs_str_with_units_to_s64(const char __user *buffer,
01880                                   unsigned long count, __s64 *val, char defunit)
01881 {
01882         __u64 mult;
01883         int rc;
01884 
01885         rc = get_mult(defunit, &mult);
01886         if (rc)
01887                 return rc;
01888 
01889         return str_to_s64_internal(buffer, count, val, mult, true);
01890 }
01891 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_str_with_units_to_s64);
01892 
01893 static char *lprocfs_strnstr(const char *s1, const char *s2, size_t len)
01894 {
01895         size_t l2;
01896 
01897         l2 = strlen(s2);
01898         if (!l2)
01899                 return (char *)s1;
01900         while (len >= l2) {
01901                 len--;
01902                 if (!memcmp(s1, s2, l2))
01903                         return (char *)s1;
01904                 s1++;
01905         }
01906         return NULL;
01907 }
01908 
01914 char *lprocfs_find_named_value(const char *buffer, const char *name,
01915                                 size_t *count)
01916 {
01917         char *val;
01918         size_t buflen = *count;
01919 
01920         /* there is no strnstr() in rhel5 and ubuntu kernels */
01921         val = lprocfs_strnstr(buffer, name, buflen);
01922         if (val == NULL)
01923                 return (char *)buffer;
01924 
01925         val += strlen(name);                             /* skip prefix */
01926         while (val < buffer + buflen && isspace(*val)) /* skip separator */
01927                 val++;
01928 
01929         *count = 0;
01930         while (val < buffer + buflen && isalnum(*val)) {
01931                 ++*count;
01932                 ++val;
01933         }
01934 
01935         return val - *count;
01936 }
01937 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_find_named_value);
01938 
01939 int lprocfs_seq_create(struct proc_dir_entry *parent,
01940                        const char *name,
01941                        mode_t mode,
01942                        const struct file_operations *seq_fops,
01943                        void *data)
01944 {
01945         struct proc_dir_entry *entry;
01946         ENTRY;
01947 
01948         /* Disallow secretly (un)writable entries. */
01949         LASSERT((seq_fops->write == NULL) == ((mode & 0222) == 0));
01950 
01951         entry = proc_create_data(name, mode, parent, seq_fops, data);
01952 
01953         if (entry == NULL)
01954                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01955 
01956         RETURN(0);
01957 }
01958 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_seq_create);
01959 
01960 int lprocfs_obd_seq_create(struct obd_device *dev,
01961                            const char *name,
01962                            mode_t mode,
01963                            const struct file_operations *seq_fops,
01964                            void *data)
01965 {
01966         return (lprocfs_seq_create(dev->obd_proc_entry, name,
01967                                    mode, seq_fops, data));
01968 }
01969 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_obd_seq_create);

01971 void lprocfs_oh_tally(struct obd_histogram *oh, unsigned int value)
01972 {
01973         if (value >= OBD_HIST_MAX)
01974                 value = OBD_HIST_MAX - 1;
01975 
01976         spin_lock(&oh->oh_lock);
01977         oh->oh_buckets[value]++;
01978         spin_unlock(&oh->oh_lock);
01979 }
01980 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_oh_tally);
01981 
01982 void lprocfs_oh_tally_log2(struct obd_histogram *oh, unsigned int value)
01983 {
01984         unsigned int val = 0;
01985 
01986         if (likely(value != 0))
01987                 val = min(fls(value - 1), OBD_HIST_MAX);
01988 
01989         lprocfs_oh_tally(oh, val);
01990 }
01991 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_oh_tally_log2);
01992 
01993 unsigned long lprocfs_oh_sum(struct obd_histogram *oh)
01994 {
01995         unsigned long ret = 0;
01996         int i;
01997 
01998         for (i = 0; i < OBD_HIST_MAX; i++)
01999                 ret +=  oh->oh_buckets[i];
02000         return ret;
02001 }
02002 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_oh_sum);
02003 
02004 void lprocfs_oh_clear(struct obd_histogram *oh)
02005 {
02006         spin_lock(&oh->oh_lock);
02007         memset(oh->oh_buckets, 0, sizeof(oh->oh_buckets));
02008         spin_unlock(&oh->oh_lock);
02009 }
02010 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_oh_clear);

02012 int lprocfs_obd_rd_max_pages_per_rpc(char *page, char **start, off_t off,
02013                                      int count, int *eof, void *data)
02014 {
02015         struct obd_device *dev = data;
02016         struct client_obd *cli = &dev->u.cli;
02017         int rc;
02018 
02019         spin_lock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
02020         rc = snprintf(page, count, "%d\n", cli->cl_max_pages_per_rpc);
02021         spin_unlock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
02022 
02023         return rc;
02024 }

02037 
02038 int lprocfs_wr_root_squash(const char __user *buffer, unsigned long count,
02039                            struct root_squash_info *squash, char *name)
02040 {
02041         int rc;
02042         char kernbuf[64], *tmp, *errmsg;
02043         unsigned long uid, gid;
02044         ENTRY;
02045 
02046         if (count >= sizeof(kernbuf)) {
02047                 errmsg = "string too long";
02048                 GOTO(failed_noprint, rc = -EINVAL);
02049         }
02050         if (copy_from_user(kernbuf, buffer, count)) {
02051                 errmsg = "bad address";
02052                 GOTO(failed_noprint, rc = -EFAULT);
02053         }
02054         kernbuf[count] = '\0';
02055 
02056         /* look for uid gid separator */
02057         tmp = strchr(kernbuf, ':');
02058         if (tmp == NULL) {
02059                 errmsg = "needs uid:gid format";
02060                 GOTO(failed, rc = -EINVAL);
02061         }
02062         *tmp = '\0';
02063         tmp++;
02064 
02065         /* parse uid */
02066         if (kstrtoul(kernbuf, 0, &uid) != 0) {
02067                 errmsg = "bad uid";
02068                 GOTO(failed, rc = -EINVAL);
02069         }
02070 
02071         /* parse gid */
02072         if (kstrtoul(tmp, 0, &gid) != 0) {
02073                 errmsg = "bad gid";
02074                 GOTO(failed, rc = -EINVAL);
02075         }
02076 
02077         squash->rsi_uid = uid;
02078         squash->rsi_gid = gid;
02079 
02080         LCONSOLE_INFO("%s: root_squash is set to %u:%u\n",
02081                       name, squash->rsi_uid, squash->rsi_gid);
02082         RETURN(count);
02083 
02084 failed:
02085         if (tmp != NULL) {
02086                 tmp--;
02087                 *tmp = ':';
02088         }
02089         CWARN("%s: failed to set root_squash to \"%s\", %s, rc = %d\n",
02090               name, kernbuf, errmsg, rc);
02091         RETURN(rc);
02092 failed_noprint:
02093         CWARN("%s: failed to set root_squash due to %s, rc = %d\n",
02094               name, errmsg, rc);
02095         RETURN(rc);
02096 }
02097 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_wr_root_squash);
02098 
02099 
02100 int lprocfs_wr_nosquash_nids(const char __user *buffer, unsigned long count,
02101                              struct root_squash_info *squash, char *name)
02102 {
02103         int rc;
02104         char *kernbuf = NULL;
02105         char *errmsg;
02106         struct list_head tmp;
02107         int len = count;
02108         ENTRY;
02109 
02110         if (count > 4096) {
02111                 errmsg = "string too long";
02112                 GOTO(failed, rc = -EINVAL);
02113         }
02114 
02115         OBD_ALLOC(kernbuf, count + 1);
02116         if (kernbuf == NULL) {
02117                 errmsg = "no memory";
02118                 GOTO(failed, rc = -ENOMEM);
02119         }
02120         if (copy_from_user(kernbuf, buffer, count)) {
02121                 errmsg = "bad address";
02122                 GOTO(failed, rc = -EFAULT);
02123         }
02124         kernbuf[count] = '\0';
02125 
02126         if (count > 0 && kernbuf[count - 1] == '\n')
02127                 len = count - 1;
02128 
02129         if ((len == 4 && strncmp(kernbuf, "NONE", len) == 0) ||
02130             (len == 5 && strncmp(kernbuf, "clear", len) == 0)) {
02131                 /* empty string is special case */
02132                 down_write(&squash->rsi_sem);
02133                 if (!list_empty(&squash->rsi_nosquash_nids))
02134                         cfs_free_nidlist(&squash->rsi_nosquash_nids);
02135                 up_write(&squash->rsi_sem);
02136                 LCONSOLE_INFO("%s: nosquash_nids is cleared\n", name);
02137                 OBD_FREE(kernbuf, count + 1);
02138                 RETURN(count);
02139         }
02140 
02141         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&tmp);
02142         if (cfs_parse_nidlist(kernbuf, count, &tmp) <= 0) {
02143                 errmsg = "can't parse";
02144                 GOTO(failed, rc = -EINVAL);
02145         }
02146         LCONSOLE_INFO("%s: nosquash_nids set to %s\n",
02147                       name, kernbuf);
02148         OBD_FREE(kernbuf, count + 1);
02149         kernbuf = NULL;
02150 
02151         down_write(&squash->rsi_sem);
02152         if (!list_empty(&squash->rsi_nosquash_nids))
02153                 cfs_free_nidlist(&squash->rsi_nosquash_nids);
02154         list_splice(&tmp, &squash->rsi_nosquash_nids);
02155         up_write(&squash->rsi_sem);
02156 
02157         RETURN(count);
02158 
02159 failed:
02160         if (kernbuf) {
02161                 CWARN("%s: failed to set nosquash_nids to \"%s\", %s rc = %d\n",
02162                       name, kernbuf, errmsg, rc);
02163                 OBD_FREE(kernbuf, count + 1);
02164         } else {
02165                 CWARN("%s: failed to set nosquash_nids due to %s rc = %d\n",
02166                       name, errmsg, rc);
02167         }
02168         RETURN(rc);
02169 }
02170 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_wr_nosquash_nids);
